answers.author: Alexandra Sheeks
answers.text:
The City of Woodinville adopted a gateway sign program several years ago that allows for directional signage for certain types of businesses.  See attached.

author: Pamela Muse
text:
An Alliance member is interested to learn if other local government have signs at city-entry-points directing drivers to local businesses.  Local businesses would pay an additional fee when they renew their annual business license to have their business listed. 
For example: as a driver exits the freeway there would a city owned/provided sign saying some like:
Welcome to _, shop our local businesses: 
          Lowes
          Home Depot
          Chico’s
          Bob’s Dry Cleaner
          Etc.
Does your agency do anything like this or know of any city’s providing a similar service for a fee?
Thank you for your time and expertise!
Pamela G Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Voice
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org
www.transformgov.org
title: City Sign to Promote Local Businesses
